content.description: Boulder start between cracks, straight to top
content.location: 6 feet north of the southwest arete

content.description: Short crack to ledge, straight up
content.location: In the middle of the northwest wall

content.description: This is likely the easiest route to the top of this block and would serve as a nice first lead for beginners.  Easy climbing with lots of gear.  Start on the face, just to the left of the arete.  Climb up the face to reach a horizontal and small overhang, traverse right to gain a large stance on the arete.  Climb the short hand crack to the top.
content.protection: 3" piece for top crack, variety of smaller pro leading to the crack.
content.location: If you approach this block from the back side of the Mungo Jelly Block, this is the corner of this block that you will first encounter.

content.description: Undercling right curving flake, straight to top. One of the old guys from the gym at pitt for places to place a bunch of nuts. From the ground, placement looks suspect. Route is grossly weathered, ie loose.
content.protection: Possibly okat placement for nuts set; maybe a place or two for <.5 cams.
content.location: 5 feet south from the northwest arete

content.description: This block hosts some of the easiest climbs at The Knobs, and is probably one of the least climbed.  There are a few good climbs here however.
